title: How efficient is carbon capture and storage? | MIT Climate Portal
body: Carbon capture and storage (CCS) is any of several technologies that trap carbon dioxide (CO 2) emitted from large industrial plants before this greenhouse gas can enter the atmosphere. CCS projects typically target 90 percent efficiency, meaning that 90 percent of the carbon dioxide from the power plant will be captured and stored.

body: They say there are six that can be cost competitive and profitable soon, even now: CO2 chemicals, concrete building materials, CO2- EOR, forestry, soil carbon sequestration, biochar. Four are not (yet?!): CO2 fuels, microalgae, bioenergy with CCS (BECCS), enhanced weathering.
